caption.p: Various studies addressing the impact of waiting time/TTI on cancer survival/prognosis

tr.td: Delay in cystectomy by > 90 days for MIBC increases pN+ rate, decreases OS, DFS and higher pathologic stage
Preoperative wait time up to 90 days does not affect survival in patients with stage II/III gastric cancer.
Post NACT-Surgery within 8 weeks or beyond 8 weeks has no impact on DFS or OS.
Significant difference in DFS and OS in early breast cancer.
More than 12 weeks’ delay is associated with increased mortality in colorectal, breast but not thyroid/lung cancers.
Surgical treatment can be postponed up to 12 months.
Increased TTI is associated with absolute increased risk of mortality in early-stage breast, lung, renal and pancreas cancers.
Increased mortality beyond 46–52 days, detrimental beyond 60 days.
No difference in recurrence/disease free survival
Rapid increase in the level of tumour thrombus with delay
Delay to surgery is associated with disease progression but not with mortality or recurrence.
ACC progresses rapidly and delay may decrease resectability and affect survival.
Time to surgery does not affect OS.
